channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A Planet Money guide to 5 fascinating new econ papers
item.description: The Planet Money newsletter rounds up some new economics studies.
item.content:encoded: The Planet Money newsletter rounds up some new economics studies.
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: How to help Texas flood survivors. And, health organizations sue RFK Jr.
item.description: Search efforts are still ongoing after the deadly Texas floods. Here's how you can help survivors. And RFK Jr.'s vaccine policy has sparked a lawsuit.
item.content:encoded:
Search efforts are still ongoing after the deadly Texas floods. Here's how you can help survivors. And RFK Jr.'s vaccine policy has sparked a lawsuit.

(Image credit: Jim Vondruska)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Trump says U.S. will resume sending weapons to Ukraine after pausing last week
item.description: With Russian attacks escalating, Ukraine is dependent on air defense systems and munitions supplied by western allies to protect Ukrainian cities.
item.content:encoded:
With Russian attacks escalating, Ukraine is dependent on air defense systems and munitions supplied by western allies to protect Ukrainian cities.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: 100 years after evolution went on trial, the Scopes case still reverberates
item.description: One hundred years ago, the small town of Dayton, Tenn., became the unlikely stage for one of the most sensational trials in American history, over the teaching of Darwin's theory of evolution.
item.content:encoded:
One hundred years ago, the small town of Dayton, Tenn., became the unlikely stage for one of the most sensational trials in American history, over the teaching of Darwin's theory of evolution.

(Image credit: Topical Press Agency)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: RFK Jr.'s vaccine policy sparks a lawsuit from the American Academy of Pediatrics
item.description: AAP and other leading health organizations allege that the health secretary violated federal law when he took the COVID vaccine off the list of recommended shots for pregnant women and healthy children.
item.content:encoded:
AAP and other leading health organizations allege that the health secretary violated federal law when he took the COVID vaccine off the list of recommended shots for pregnant women and healthy children.

(Image credit: aire images/Moment RF)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Feds investigate hospitals over religious exemptions from gender-affirming care
item.description: A physician assistant claimed she was fired by a Michigan hospital for seeking a religious exemption regarding gender-affirming care. Now the federal government is also investigating.
item.content:encoded:
A physician assistant claimed she was fired by a Michigan hospital for seeking a religious exemption regarding gender-affirming care. Now the federal government is also investigating.

(Image credit: SETH HERALD)
item.dc:creator: Kate Wells

item.title: Want to make yourself less appealing to mosquitoes? Our quiz has surprising ideas
item.description: Level up your knowledge of mosquito bite prevention with our quiz. It's full of surprising, science-backed tactics that may save you from getting eaten alive this summer.
item.content:encoded:
Level up your knowledge of mosquito bite prevention with our quiz. It's full of surprising, science-backed tactics that may save you from getting eaten alive this summer.

(Image credit: Beck Harlan/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: Sea lions are released after toxic algae bloom in California
item.description: Marine mammal researchers are investigating how sea lions were affected by the longest toxic algal bloom on record off the coast of Southern California. Some sea lions are now being released back into the wild.
item.content:encoded:
Marine mammal researchers are investigating how sea lions were affected by the longest toxic algal bloom on record off the coast of Southern California. Some sea lions are now being released back into the wild.

(Image credit: Courtney Theophin)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: The U.S. has millions of old gas and oil wells. Here's what it takes to plug them up
item.description: There was a circle in Maria Burns' yard where grass wouldn't grow and trees died. She knew what it was: An old natural gas well, plugged when she was a little girl, starting to leak again.
item.content:encoded:
There was a circle in Maria Burns' yard where grass wouldn't grow and trees died. She knew what it was: An old natural gas well, plugged when she was a little girl, starting to leak again.

(Image credit: Maddie McGarvey for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: The health of U.S. kids has declined significantly since 2007, a new study finds
item.description: A new study in the journal JAMA finds the health of America's children has worsened across several key indicators over the last two decades. That includes the number of children with chronic diseases.
item.content:encoded:
A new study in the journal JAMA finds the health of America's children has worsened across several key indicators over the last two decades. That includes the number of children with chronic diseases.

(Image credit: ljubaphoto)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy
